intro: Draba cuatrecasasiana, commonly known as the Cuatrecasas's whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops and weeds. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with basal leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in alpine and subalpine environments, often growing in rocky or gravelly soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
